meanings.definition: An arrangement or distribution into zones.
meanings.sent1: The zonation of the classroom seating made it easier for the teacher to monitor all the students.
meanings.sent2: City planners used zonation to designate different areas for residential and commercial purposes.
meanings.sent3: The zonation of toppings on the pizza caused a debate among friends about the best combination.
meanings.sent4: In the zonation of the garden, the flowers acted as colorful markers separating the different sections.
meanings.sent5: The zonation of colors in the sunset painted the sky with layers of pink, orange, and purple.

meanings.definition: The division of an area into zones or regions.
meanings.sent1: Zonation of the park allowed for specific areas for picnics, sports, and relaxation.
meanings.sent2: During the urban zonation process, the city was divided into residential, commercial, and industrial zones.
meanings.sent3: The zonation of the library into quiet study zones and group discussion zones helped maintain a peaceful environment.
meanings.sent4: The zonation of the forest into different regions created diverse habitats for various wildlife species.
meanings.sent5: Zonation of the beach into swimming, surfing, and sunbathing sections ensured safety and enjoyment for all visitors.
